title.narrative: Regional Technical Cooperation and Capacity Building Activities

description.narrative: The BMIC is an international event that has become the largest gathering of national Government authorities specializing in immigration, home affairs, border control, civil registration, customs, population management, justice, health, public security and other agencies with responsibilities in the area of Immigration, Border and Identity management. The conference and its exhibition offer proven platforms for sharing of information, experiences on new developments in border and identity management for representatives of the mentioned stakeholders. In coordination with IOM’s co-organizer, the Asia Pacific Smart Card Association (APSCA), IOM will organize the 6th edition of the BMIC on 1 – 3 December 2021 in Bangkok, Thailand. IOM will define the BMIC’s themes and focus including the conference programmes and speakers, especially from governments, UN agencies and international organizations across the globe, to present the topics related to the conference’s themes. In addition, IOM will ensure the attendance and involvement of government authorities in the conference, by closely coordinating with IOM missions both in Asia-Pacific region and beyond to liaise with and coordinate for the participation of their respective government counterparts.
